title: Tributes paid to 'brave' schoolboy, 15, who lost cancer battle after being diagnosed on Christmas Eve
text:
Tributes paid to 'brave' schoolboy, 15, who lost cancer battle after being diagnosed on Christmas Eve Joshua Martin battled for 14 months after doctors found tumours in his abdomen Share Josh Martin lost his battle with cancer (Photo: Facebook/Kim Martin)     
Heartfelt tributes have been paid to a "brave" schoolboy who died from cancer this evening. 
Joshua Martin, 15, was diagnosed with cancer on Christmas Eve 2014 after doctors discovered a number of tumours in his abdomen. 
The schoolboy was backed by well-wishers from around the world throughout his illness, with thousands of messages of support sent along with the hash-tag #PrayForJosh. 
In a statement on her Facebook on Monday evening, mum Kim Martin said: "We are devastated beyond words to tell you that our beautiful son passed away this evening. Joshua was the most amazing young man, brave and mature beyond his years." Josh Martin (Photo: Facebook/Kim Martin) Josh's mum broke the devastating news on Facebook (Photo: Facebook/Kim Martin) 
"His life and testimony touched hundreds of thousands of people worldwide and we are so very thankful that the power of God touched him in a way that many people don't experience in a lifetime. 
"While we are heartbroken, we have a deep peace knowing that Joshua is with His Heavenly Father in glory. 
"To all of you, our friends and family, who have loved us, supported us, and journeyed with us, we want to say thank you. Funeral arrangements will follow. Please note the house is strictly private." 
Tributes flooded in on Facebook for the brave teen, BelfastLive reports. Tributes flooded in for Josh (Photo: Facebook/Kim Martin) Josh was described as "brave, enthusiastic and had an inspiring outlook on life" (Photo: Facebook/Kim Martin) 
Bangor Elim Church, where dad Tim was on the pastoral staff, posted a tribute: "Such heartbreaking news tonight. Josh's courage, bravery and determination to live a normal life despite his illness was truly inspirational." 
Bangor Elim Youth added: "We are heartbroken by the news that our much loved Josh Martin passed away tonight. 
"Josh was an integral part of Bangor Elim Youth - he was brave, enthusiastic, and had an inspiring outlook on life. His love for Jesus was incredible & while we break our hearts, we know he is now with Jesus." 
Bangor councillor, Peter Martin, also paid tribute to Joshua, writing: "Very sad to hear the news that Josh Martin passed away this evening. My thoughts & prayers are with Tim, Kim & the whole family." 
One person said: "I am truly sorry for your family's loss. Josh touched the hearts of many during his battle. Safe in the arms of Jesus xxx" 
Another posted: "So sorry to hear that, didn't know him but every picture I seen of him he always had a smile on his wee face he is in a better place and will suffer no more." 
One paid tribute to Joshua's strength, writing: "We are so sad to hear this. Your family is in our prayers, we hope God's love brings you peace in the coming weeks and months, Joshua was a great young man and his journey will always be an example of strength and faith in all the lives his story has touched x" Like us on Facebook
